column2: Used to check memory statistics or RAM on system
Used to either print environment variables. It is also used to run a utility or command in a custom environment
Used to display the differences in the files by comparing the files line by line
Used to clear the terminal screen
Used to find files and directories and perform subsequent operations on them
Used to display line of text/string that are passed as an argument
Searches a file for a particular pattern of characters and displays all lines that contain that pattern
Used to display information related to file systems about total space and available space
Used to change the file Owner or group
Instructs the shell to replace one string with another string while executing the commands
Reads data from file and gives their content as output. It helps us to: -create -view -and concatenate files
Allows an administrator to set or modify a file's permissions
Used to get information about currently logged in user on to system
Provides a Provides a dynamic real-time view of the running system
Used to terminate processes manually. kill command sends a signal to a process which terminates the process
Used to list the currently running processes and their PIDs along with some other information depends on different options
Compiles different program pieces and builds a final executable.
GNU Compiler Collections is used to compile mainly C and C++ language. It can also be used to compile Objective C and Objective C++
Used for: -preprocessing -compilation -assembly -and linking of source code to generate an executable file
Used to display the user manual of any command that we can run on the terminal
Used to copy file(s) between servers in a secure way.
Protocol used to securely connect to a remote server/system

Copy
